- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: KDE neon 5.10.4

It would be good to have shortcuts in a dialog. This would make it possible to answer questions without moving a hand from keyboard to mouse. For example the **Do you want to save the changes you made to Untitled-1?** forces me to use the mouse. I can cancel with `esc` but what I want is to press `n` for do not save.

data.title: Prompt to reopen and save file in admin mode on save of protected file

When attempting to save a file in Windows while not in administrator mode where the file is [protected|read-only|system] pops up a message that the save failed with options like save-as, retry, cancel.  
Add an option to restart visual studio code in admin mode and save.

Try this in notepad++ for an example.

data.title: Must tab through deleted tab stops in snippets
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.5

Using the following PHP snippet:

```json
"function …": {
	"prefix": "fun",
	"body": [
		"${1:public }function ${2:FunctionName}(${3:${4:${5:Type} }$${6:var}${7: = ${8:null}}})",
		"{",
		"\t${0:# code...}",
		"}"
	],
	"description": "Function"
},
```
Which generates:
```php
public function FunctionName(Type $var = null)
{
    # code...
}
```
If I don't want any function arguements and I delete the code inbetween `(` and `)` that is generated from the snippet, I have to press tab 6 times after entering tabstop `3` to get to tabstop `0`.

It would be ideal if the snippet controller and session were able to understand that tab stop `3` was deleted so the nested tab stops would then be ignored.

data.title: Show visual hints for column breakpoints (inline breakpoints)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: In https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14784 we implemented column breakpoints which is now available for our Chrome and Node debuggers, but discoverability of this very useful feature is rather limited, as you have to set column breakpoints via shift+F9. Chrome DevTools recently shipped `inline breakpoints` that's a UI on top of column breakpoints, that work's by a user setting the initial breakpoint by clicking on the line number. Light blue markers now appear on this same line next to any place where an inline breakpoint can be set. ![](https://umaar.com/assets/images/dev-tips/inline-breakpoints.gif) Details: https://umaar.com/dev-tips/129-inline-breakpoints/ ## The rationale We want VS Code to be the best place for editing for JavaScript developers, and column breakpoints has shown to be helpful especially for developer debugging promise-based flows. Adding visual hints for column breakpoints will provide value to our JavaScript developers and will also bring the VS Code debugging experience on pair with Chrome DevTools. We already support Column breakpoints and given that two of our top debuggers Chrome and Node already supports `getPossibleBreakpoints`, it's relatively low effort to implement this functionality. ## The experience 1. User sets regular/initial breakpoint by clicking on the line number. 2. Light red visual hints (similar to how to show hints in the gutter) now appear on this same line next to any place where an inline breakpoint can be set. 3. User can not toggle these visual hints into column breakpoints (same as pressing SHIFT+F9 at the location) **Visual hint** ![inline breakpoints vs](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/173559/28693101-1b7df92a-72d8-11e7-9910-cae7cdf4fb6c.png) **Column breakpoint set** ## Arguments against 1. Only a few debuggers supports column breakpoints, and therefore we shouldn't prioritize this functionality unless more debuggers gain support. ## Technical details Chrome/Node has implemented a new [`Debugger.getPossibleBreakpoints`](https://chromedevtools.github.io/devtools-protocol/tot/Debugger/#method-getPossibleBreakpoints) that returns a list of the possible breakpoint locations, which is used to light up the visual hints ### VS Debug Protocol I assume the VS Debug Protocol could have to get extended to support this?

data.title: Tasks/Terminal: Run Selected Text in Terminal won't launch terminal with background task in progress
data.body:
Code 1.14.2 and the insiders 7-24
Windows 7

Steps to reproduce:
- Use background or watch task such as build VS Code
- select file with whatever shell commands, select line
- Attempt to use Run Selected Text
- no new terminal or previously open terminal will be used, command is ignored
- It does not matter if the task is currently executing or idle

data.title: VSCode Defaults to PS Integrated Terminal instead of Native PS
data.body:
Hello,

The issue I'm experiencing with VSCode is the only thing preventing me from using it full time.

I want to force VSCode to default to 'powershell.exe' not 'Powershell Integrated Terminal' for various reasons. Better code completion, color formatting, etc. It seems however; no matter what it defaults back to the integrated terminal **_on code execution and on startup._** This is a bare-bones VSCode installation on Windows with just the Powershell extension installed.

Here is my settings file.

```
{
    "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": 
    "C:\\Windows\\System32\\WindowsPowerShell\\v1.0\\powershell.exe",
    "powershell.integratedConsole.showOnStartup": false,
    "powershell.integratedConsole.focusConsoleOnExecute": false
}
```


VS Code version running default 32 bit as administrator on a Windows x64 10 install.
```
- VSCode Version:
Visual Studio Code
Version 1.14.2
Commit cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e
Date 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z
Shell 1.6.6
Renderer 56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0
```

Windows 10 OS Version
```
- OS Version:
>> [Environment]::OSVersion.Version
Major  Minor  Build  Revision
-----  -----  -----  --------
10     0      15063  0
```

Powershell version from native powershell.exe in Windows 10.
```
-PS Version:
>> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.15063.483
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.15063.483
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

data.title: Feature Request: Don't include file extension in file sorting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:19.566Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
csharp|ms-|1.11.0



---

Feature Request:

I'd like it if the `EXPLORER` view did not sort files using their file extensions (unless necessary).

E.g.,
- schema-grid.js
- schema-grid-aggregator.js

The above files should appear in the order I've specified. However they appear in reverse order, I'm guessing because `-` comes before `.` in some imaginary ordinal system. I figure if we remove extensions from this equation it'll appear in the order I've specified.

All the same I love VSCode. Keep up the good work.

data.title: Unable to reattach automatically to reconnected mapped drive
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
mssql|ms-|1.1.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. On Mac, connect to server
2. Open folder of files in VSCode on the mapped drive
3. Edit a file, do not save
4. Disconnect the server
5. Reconnect it using same spec as before
6. VSCode does not remap drive, says edited file is "(deleted from disk)"

BUT

7. Close window, lose changes
8. File / New Window, File / open
9. VSCode defaults to same location on mapped drive, do not need to navigate there

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Copy the error in problems view
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions: the listing length exceeds browsers' URL characters limit
---
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a python file and add some problematic code
`from requests import hello`
2. The problems view says `No name 'hello' in module 'requests'`

When I right click on copy this problem it copies the following:
``` 
file: 'file:abc.py'
severity: 'Error'
message: 'E0611:No name 'hello' in module 'requests''
at: '5,1'
source: 'pylint'
```
Possible to expose another `copy` command to copy just the error itself for quick googling? This is a feature request and probably low priority. Still wanted to document and get feedback. 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: 2 UIs to open loaded scripts: view extension and command to show loaded scripts

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Testing #31327

There are new 2 UIs for loaded scripts:
- view contribution in the debug viewlet
- command to show loaded scripts in the quick pick

Suggest to unify/simplify. The quick pick has the benefit that you can search for scripts. So one suggestion is to add a search scripts toolbar button to the view contribution that shows the quick pick dialog. Selecting an item from the quick pick opens the script and selects it in the loaded scripts view.

data.title: vscode doesn't refresh files modified externally

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a very large project. 
2. Open one of the files in the editor (possibly several ones? I have about 40 files open now)
3. Either:
    - Modify the file externally, or 
    - Switch to another branch where the file is modified, or
    - Modify the file in the editor, then externally in a terminal stash the changes.
4. Expect that the editor where the modified file is open will refresh - no need to Reload Window.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes.

data.title: Snippets: make parser ignore `${0|choice|}`
data.body:
Testing #31324

The following snippet currently gets interpreted as simple `hello world`. The syntax is invalid since zero can't be used for choices. It should just ignore that syntax and bypass the literal characters.

```json
"hello": {
	"prefix": "hello",
	"body": "hello ${0|world,joao,monaco|}"
}
```
